head.title: Sure Hands on Drawbridge? Yeah, Sure

hedline.hl1: Sure Hands on Drawbridge? Yeah, Sure

abstract.p: Rick Lewis letter on Department of Transportation's job of managing drawbrige on Loop Parkway in East Meadow, Long Island (S)

block.p: People usually send letters to the editor when they want to complain.

Instead, I would like to commend the Department of Transportation for the outstanding job it is doing in managing the drawbridge on the Loop Parkway: Every time a large sail or powerboat approaches, the operator raises the bridge, even if it had just been lowered.
People usually send letters to the editor when they want to complain.

Instead, I would like to commend the Department of Transportation for the outstanding job it is doing in managing the drawbridge on the Loop Parkway: Every time a large sail or powerboat approaches, the operator raises the bridge, even if it had just been lowered.

It's important to move these boats along, especially the gambling boats out of Freeport, and if hundreds of motorists on their way to or from public beaches have to wait, well, that's too bad. Who cares if thousands of gallons of gasoline are wasted? Why should the D.O.T. stick to a schedule when they can raise the bridge, lower it and raise it again in three minutes when another boat needs to pass?
The Department of Transportation deserves a pat on the back for a job well done.
